overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a detailed heuristic approach to time-series forecasting, focusing on identifying patterns and trends in limited data. The analyst recognizes daily seasonality and an increasing trend, then develops a custom forecasting method combining pattern averaging and trend projection. The approach is constrained by the text-based environment, leading to manual calculations and simplifications instead of formal statistical models.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in provided data
Hourly temperature fluctuations (night dips, daytime rises)
key_insights: Daily average temperature shows an upward trend despite a dip on day 2
Patterns from recent days (especially last 2 days) are most relevant for forecasting
Linear trend projection based on daily averages drives future level adjustments
Manual decomposition of data into night/morning/afternoon/evening segments for analysis
Base pattern adjustment via additive offsets to project future values
complexity_analysis: Highly detailed with multi-step heuristic analysis involving pattern averaging, trend projection, and manual data decomposition, but avoids formal statistical models due to implementation constraints.
